column4: wow, can someone help me with deleting a file!? I am root, and cant chown or chmod the file whatsoever, do Not have permission to do anything? What is going on?
what does ls -l <file> say (that's lower case L)
and also, ls -ld .  <---- note trailing dot
the containing directory has to be wx by root I think
drwxr-xr-x 3 root root  4096 2009-12-13 20:40 .     -r--r--r-- 1 root root 12800 2009-12-13 14:07 extlinux.sys
well I  chmod -wx to the directory it is contained in, but did not help to delete the file within
I believe it was   wx before, now all the permission are completely different
that's weird. Is there something you haven't told me about this filesystem?

well.... its a mounted partition on a USB Drive that is formated to fat32. I used Unetbootin to install a MintLinux distro to it. But now I want to delete all the contents of the partition, which I have, except this file.
since you're wiping the partition anyway, why not just reformat it....?
yea I gess I can do that
yes, Thank you for the help
you have to make sure the uuids and the file pathnames are correct
